sense.def:
To say something
pomeni izgovoriti besede.

seg.quote: ‘Please come in,’ she said.
He said it was an accident.
He had said nothing to me about his meeting.

sense.def:
Z besedo
say
uvedemo mnenje ali komentar.

seg.quote: I just want to say how pleased I am to be here.
One thing you have to say about Americans: they love drama.

sense.def:
To say something in a letter or a book
pomeni izraziti tisto v pisni obliki, na primer v pismu ali knjigi.

seg.quote: She wrote to say she wanted to meet me in London.
There were stickers all over the crate saying: ‘Glass—Handle with Care’.

sense.def:
Kadar ura ali zemljevid
says a particular thing
, na njem lahko razberemo določene podatke.

seg.quote: The clock says that it is six o'clock.
The road was not where the map said it should be.

sense.def:
To say something about a person, situation, or thing
pomeni, da razkrijemo nekaj o določeni osebi, razmerah ali stvari.

seg.quote: The title says it all.
Their glances seemed to be saying something about their relationship.

sense.def:
Izraz
say
uporabimo, ko nekaj navedemo kot primer ali ko navedemo približno količino ali čas.

seg.quote: Compare, say, a Michelangelo painting with a Van Gogh.
...in the next, say, ten years.

sense.def:
To have a say in something
pomeni imeti pravico, da povemo svoje mnenje in vplivamo na odločitve.

seg.quote: People want a much greater say in how the country should be governed.

sense.def:
To say something to oneself
pomeni, da nekaj mislimo sami pri sebi, ne rečemo pa tega naglas.

seg.quote: I began to say to myself, ‘What about becoming an actor?’

sense.def:
Izraze, kot sta
just say
in
let's say
, uporabljamo, kadar želimo načeti pogovor o nečem, kar se utegne zgoditi ali biti res.

seg.quote: Just say you found treasure in your garden. Would you sell it?

sense.def:
Izraz
to say the least
označuje, da so stvari veliko bolj resne, pretresljive ali skrajne, kot pravimo, da so.

seg.quote: She lacked tact (to say the least) in expressing her views.
The Romans left Britain in 410 AD—that is to say, England was under Roman rule for nearly 500 years.

sense.def:
Izraz
to say nothing of
uporabimo, preden navedemo nekaj, s čimer dodatno podpremo svojo trditev.

seg.quote: The effort required is immense, to say nothing of the cost.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes without saying
, je očitno ali zelo verjetno res.

cit.quote: samoumevno je, samo po sebi se razume, seveda

seg.quote: It goes without saying that I am grateful for all your help.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
has a lot to be said for it
, ima veliko dobrih lastnosti.

cit.quote: imeti vrednost, zaslužiti pozornost ali pohvalo

sense.def:
To have one's say
pomeni izraziti svoje mnenje.
